author: brane
msg: I hate casts. Only a dead cast is a good cast.

author: brane
msg: * doc/handbook/repos_admin.texi: Database log files will now be 1MB by
default. It's no longer necessary to pass the -e flag to db_recover.
Users of hot-backup.py don't have to run db_recover before they can

author: blair

"...".  Do not place @dots{} in [] because the @dots{} will already be
Add documentation on when to use and not use @dots{} and @enddots{}.

author: brane
msg: Move Berkeley DB configuration from the code into the DB_CONFIG file,
and change the way we open the database environment in preparation for
(svn_fs_create_berkeley): Set it in the default DB_CONFIG file
instead.  Move the comment from allocate_env into the DB_CONFIG file,
and bump the default in-memory log buffer size to 256K, as it was done
Oh, and don't call strlen to get the length of a constant string.
(svn_fs_open_berkeley): Always pass the DB_CREATE flag to env->open,
so that the shared memory environment files are recreated as
This means it is no longer necessary to call db_recover with the -e
flag when recovering Subversion databases, which brings us to:
* tools/backup/hot-backup.py: Call db_recover on the archived database
to put it in a consistent state and remove the shared-mem environment
files. This saves some space in the backup, and makes it ready for
